data.title: Ronnie DeVoe bio: age, height, net worth, who is he married to?
data.meta_description: RONNIE DEVOE is a talented American rapper and singer who joined the music industry decades ago. Find out more about his life journey, net worth, and love life
data.text:
Ronnie DeVoe is famously known as an American rapper and singer. He is a member of both the pop/R&B groups New Edition and Bell Biv DeVoe. With the latter, he has made a significant contribution to the studio albums Hootie Mack and Poison. His other group, New Edition, has released amazing albums, including Under the Blue Moon and All for Love.

Besides performing and recording, he is also the co-owner of a real estate company in Atlanta, Georgia, known as DeVoe Broker Associates.

Profile summary

Full name: Ronald Boyd DeVoe Jr.

Date of birth: November 17, 1967

Age: 53 (as of 2020)

Place of birth: Roxbury, Boston

Nationality: American

Occupation: Rapper

Zodiac sign: Scorpio

Instagram: @bigrondevoe

How old is Ronnie DeVoe?

Ronnie was born on November 17, 1967 in Roxbury, Massachusetts. Ronnie DeVoe age is 53 years (as of 2020).

Family and education

He was born into the family of Florence E. DeVoe (Ronnie DeVoe mom) and Ronald Boyd (his father). Ronnie grew up alongside four siblings and attended Newton North High School.

Career

His career peaked in the early 1980s after he joined New Edition, an R&B/pop group. In 1984, they released an album that featured Cool It Now, a track which gained massive praise and attention. As a result, the entire album was rated 2x Platinum.

They later created another album called All for Love. The Recording Industry Association of America (RIAA) certified it with Platinum status.

In 1986, the band created their fourth studio album, which they called Under the Blue Moon. Luckily, this one acquired a gold status. After two years, they released yet another album called Heart Break. It featured several tracks such as Can You Stand the Rain, You’re Not My Kind of Girl, and If It Isn’t Love.

In 1990, the New Edition group decided to part ways. Due to this, Ricky Bell, Michael Bivins, and himself got together to create another R&B group which they called Bell Biv DeVoe (BBD).

With the new group, they released 5 hit singles which were in their debut album, Poison. Some of the singles in the album were B.B.D. and Poison. The album did very well as it sold more than five million copies.

Later in 1993, the group released a follow-up album called Hootie Mack. After three years, Ronald Boyd and the New Edition original members recorded their Home Again album. Some of the songs in the album were I’m Still in Love with You and Hit Me Off .

In 2001, they released their third studio album called BBD. They later released Three Stripes.

In 2018, he began featuring in The Real Housewives of Atlanta with his wife Shamari. In December of the same year, the couple released a song called Love Comes Through.

Ronnie Devoe family

Who is Ronnie DeVoe married to? Ronnie DeVoe wife is Shamari DeVoe. Before their union, she went by the name Shamari Fears.

Shamari is an actress, reality star, and singer. Her music career began in the 1990s in a group called Blaque. The other members of the group were Brandi Williams and Natina Reed.

When did Ronnie DeVoe get married? The couple tied the knot on March 10, 2005.

Does Ronnie DeVoe have kids?

Yes, he does. On July 14, 2017, Shamari delivered lovely twins. Ronnie DeVoe twin boys go by the names Roman Elijah and Ronald III.

What is Ronnie DeVoe net worth?

His net worth is estimated to be $15 million.

How tall is Ronnie DeVoe?

He measures 1.83 meters.

Ronnie DeVoe is truly an inspiration to individuals in the entertainment industry. This is because he has managed to stay relevant despite starting his career decades ago.
